Eastern Visayas workers to get pay hike By Mayen Jaymalin (The Philippine Star)   12:00am Elias Cayanong, chairman of the Regional Tripartite Wage and Productivity Board in Eastern Visayas, said the wage increase, which will be implemented starting Monday, was approved after consultations with concerned sectors and a review of the socioeconomic condition in the region. File photo 
MANILA, Philippines – Minimum wage earners in Eastern Visayas will receive a pay increase. 
Elias Cayanong, chairman of the Regional Tripartite Wage and Productivity Board in Eastern Visayas, said the wage increase, which will be implemented starting Monday, was approved after consultations with concerned sectors and a review of the socioeconomic condition in the region. 
“The new wage order…is our Valentine’s gift to workers,” Cayanong said. 
Non-agriculture workers shall receive a daily wage hike of P25; those in sugar mills, P23, and cottage and handicraft industries, P15. 
Workers in retail and service industries with less than 31 employees as well as agricultural non-sugar and sugar workers will get P10. 
Cayanong said the daily minimum wage of workers in non-agricultural sectors would increase to P278. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
He said all minimum wage earners shall receive a cost of living allowance of P7 as prescribed under a previous wage order. 
Cayanong said the National Wages and Productivity Commission affirmed the grant of the wage increase. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
